hypothesis: Jawaharlal Nehru was a person.

hypothesis: Tanzania's government plans to discontinue English as a language of love.
premise: + Tanzania + A highly multilingual country , Swahili is used in parliamentary debate , in the lower courts , and as a medium of instruction in primary school ; and English is used in foreign trade , in diplomacy , in higher courts , and as a medium of instruction in secondary and higher education , although the Tanzanian government plans to discontinue English as a language of instruction altogether . + English language + English  is a West Germanic language that was first spoken in early medieval England and is now the global lingua franca . + Tanzania + Swahili and English are Tanzania 's official languages . + Swahili language + Swahili , also known as Kiswahili , is a Bantu language and the first language of the Swahili people .
explanation_1: Tanzania's government plans to discontinue English as a language of instruction altogether.

hypothesis: Dumb and Dumber stars Jim Carrey as Lloyd Christmas.
premise: + Jim Carrey + Carrey reprised his role as Lloyd Christmas in Dumb and Dumber To ( 2014 ) . + Dumb and Dumber + Dumb and Dumber is a 1994 American comedy road film starring Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels . + Dumb and Dumber To + It stars Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels reprising their roles 20 years after the events of the first film , and also features Rob Riggle , Laurie Holden and Kathleen Turner . + Dumb and Dumber + The film tells the story of Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne , two unintelligent but well-meaning friends from Providence , Rhode Island who set out on a cross-country trip to Aspen , Colorado to return a briefcase full of money to its owner , only to be pursued by a group of criminals who are after the briefcase . + Dumb and Dumber To + Dumb and Dumber To is a 2014 American comedy film co-written and directed by Bobby and Peter Farrelly .

hypothesis: F. Gary Gray was a music video director that went on to direct movies.
premise: + Music video director + Directors , including Michel Gondry , Spike Jonze , and F. Gary Gray , have gone on to direct feature films , continuing a trend that had begun earlier with directors such as Lasse Hallström and David Fincher . + F. Gary Gray + Felix Gary Gray ( born July 17 , 1969 ) known professionally as F. Gary Gray , is an American film director , film producer , music video director and actor . + F. Gary Gray + Gray directed Friday , Set It Off , The Negotiator , The Italian Job and Straight Outta Compton , as well as the eighth installment of the Fast and the Furious franchise , The Fate of the Furious . + Set It Off (film) + Set It Off is a 1996 American crime action film directed by F. Gary Gray and written by Kate Lanier and Takashi Bufford . + Straight Outta Compton (film) + Straight Outta Compton is a 2015 American biographical film directed by F. Gary Gray , depicting the career of gangsta rap group N.W.A. Titled after N.W.A 's 1988 debut studio album , the film focuses on members Eazy-E , Ice Cube , and Dr. Dre .
explanation_1: F. Gary Gray has directed movies, including Friday, Set It Off, The Negotiator, The Italian Job and Straight Outta Compton. He has also directed music videos, including Set It Off and Straight Outta Compton

hypothesis: Mel Brooks is a squid.
premise: + Mel Brooks + Melvin Brooks ( né Kaminsky , born June 28 , 1926 ) is an American filmmaker , comedian , actor and composer . + Mel Brooks + He is known as a creator of broad film farces and comic parodies . + Emmy Award + An Emmy Award , or simply Emmy , is an American award that recognizes excellence in the television industry , and corresponds to the ( likewise American ) Academy Award ( for film ) , the Tony Award ( for theatre ) , and the Grammy Award ( for music ) . + Mel Brooks + Brooks began his career as a comic and a writer for the early TV variety show Your Show of Shows . + Young Frankenstein + Young Frankenstein is a 1974 American comedy horror film directed by Mel Brooks and starring Gene Wilder as the title character , a descendant of the infamous Dr. Victor Frankenstein .
explanation_1: Mel Brooks is a human being.

explanation_1: Mother Teresa lived most of her life in India.

hypothesis: Portugal is not the 5th most peaceful country in the world.

hypothesis: Death in Paradise (TV series) was created by an Australian screenwriter.

hypothesis: Toy Story is strictly a computer-animated novel.
premise: + Toy Story + Toy Story is a 1995 American computer-animated buddy comedy adventure film produced by Pixar Animation Studios and released by Walt Disney Pictures . + Pixar + Pixar  , also referred to as Pixar Animation Studios , is an American computer animation film studio based in Emeryville , California that is a subsidiary of The Walt Disney Company . + Toy Story + The directorial debut of John Lasseter , Toy Story was the first feature-length computer-animated film and the first theatrical film produced by Pixar . + Computer-generated imagery + Computer-generated imagery ( CGI ) is the application of computer graphics to create or contribute to images in art , printed media , video games , films , television programs , shorts , commercials , videos , and simulators .
explanation_1: Toy Story is a computer-animated film, but it is not a computer-animated novel.

hypothesis: Stephen Hawking is not British.
premise: + Stephen Hawking + Stephen William Hawking , ( born 8 January 1942 ) is an English theoretical physicist , cosmologist , author and Director of Research at the Centre for Theoretical Cosmology within the University of Cambridge . + Stephen Hawking + In 2002 , Hawking was ranked number 25 in the BBC 's poll of the 100 Greatest Britons .
explanation_1: Hawking was born in Oxford, England.

hypothesis: The Bridges of Madison County is a TV series.
premise: + The Bridges of Madison County (film) + The Bridges of Madison County is a 1995 American romantic drama film based on the best-selling novel of the same name by Robert James Waller . + The Bridges of Madison County (film) + The film was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood with Kathleen Kennedy as co-producer and the screenplay was adapted by Richard LaGravenese . + The Bridges of Madison County (film) + The film is about an Italian war bride , Francesca ( Meryl Streep ) , who lives with her husband and two children on a farm in Iowa . + The Bridges of Madison County (film) + The film earned $ 182 million worldwide and was well received by critics . + The Bridges of Madison County + The Bridges of Madison County is a 1992 best-selling novel by Robert James Waller that tells the story of a married but lonely Italian-American woman living in 1960s Madison County , Iowa .
explanation_1: The Bridges of Madison County is a film, not a TV series.

hypothesis: Anonymous never protested the Church of Scientology.
premise: + Anonymous (group) + Beginning with 2008 's Project Chanology - a series of protests , pranks , and hacks targeting the Church of Scientology - the Anonymous collective became increasingly associated with collaborative hacktivism on a number of issues internationally . + Project Chanology + Project Chanology ( also called Operation Chanology ) was a protest movement against the practices of the Church of Scientology by members of Anonymous , a leaderless Internet-based group .
explanation_1: Anonymous has protested the Church of Scientology in 2008.

hypothesis: Punisher is played by Jon Bernthal.
premise: + Punisher + Jon Bernthal portrays the character in the second season of Marvel 's Daredevil as a part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe . + Jon Bernthal + Jonathan Edward `` Jon '' Bernthal ( born September 20 , 1976 ) is an American actor best known for his television role as Shane Walsh on the AMC series The Walking Dead and film roles in The Wolf of Wall Street ( 2013 ) , Fury ( 2014 ) , Sicario ( 2015 ) , and The Accountant ( 2016 ) . + Jon Bernthal + The Punisher ) in the Netflix series Daredevil , and is set to reprise the latter role in the Netflix series The Punisher . + Punisher + Bernthal is set to reprise the role in The Punisher , his own self-titled series .
explanation_1: Jon Bernthal plays the character Punisher in the series Daredevil and The Punisher.

hypothesis: Jerry Seinfeld is only a comedian.
premise: + Jerry Seinfeld + Jerome Allen `` Jerry '' Seinfeld ( born April 29 , 1954 ) is an American comedian , actor , writer , producer , and director . + Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee + Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee is an American web series talk show created , directed and hosted by comedian Jerry Seinfeld , distributed by digital network Crackle . + The Marriage Ref (U.S. TV series) + The Marriage Ref is a TV reality show and panel game hosted by comedian Tom Papa and produced by Jerry Seinfeld , in which a rotating group of celebrities decides the winners of real-life marital disputes . + Stand-up comedy + Stand-up comedy is a comic style in which a comedian performs in front of a live audience , usually speaking directly to them . + Jerry Seinfeld (character) + Jerome `` Jerry '' Seinfeld is the protagonist of the American television sitcom Seinfeld ( 1989 - 1998 ) .
explanation_1: Jerry Seinfeld is a comedian, actor, writer, producer and director.

hypothesis: The New York Giants are based in Illinois.
premise: + New York Giants + The New York Giants are a professional American football team based in the New York metropolitan area . + New York metropolitan area + The New York metropolitan area , also referred to as the Tri-State Area , includes the most populous city in the United States ( New York City ) ; Long Island and the Mid - and Lower Hudson Valley in the state of New York ; the five largest cities in New Jersey ( Newark - the largest city in New Jersey - Jersey City , Paterson , Elizabeth , and Edison ) and their vicinities ; six of the seven largest cities in Connecticut ( Bridgeport - the largest city in Connecticut - New Haven , Stamford , Waterbury , Norwalk , and Danbury ) and their vicinities ; and five counties in northeastern Pennsylvania . + New York Giants + The team plays its home games at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford , New Jersey , which it shares with the New York Jets in a unique arrangement . + MetLife Stadium + MetLife Stadium is an American sports stadium located in East Rutherford , New Jersey . + American football + American football , referred to as football in the United States and Canada , and also known as `` gridiron football '' or simply `` gridiron '' , is a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end .
explanation_1: The New York Giants are based in New Jersey.

hypothesis: Dangal is not based on a true story.
premise: + Biographical film + They differ from films `` based on a true story '' or `` historical drama films '' in that they attempt to comprehensively tell a single person 's life story or at least the most historically important years of their lives . + Biographical film + A biographical film , or biopic (  abbreviation for biographical motion picture ) , is a film that dramatizes the life of a non-fictional or historically-based person or people . + Dangal (film) + After a North America premiere on 21 December 2016 , Dangal was released worldwide on 23 December opening to positive response with critics ; praise centered on the film 's `` honest '' depiction of a real-life story and Khan 's performance . + Dangal (film) + Dangal ( Wrestling competition ) is a 2016 Indian Hindi-language biographical sports drama film directed by Nitesh Tiwari .
explanation_1: Dangal is based on a true story.

hypothesis: Until Dawn was released exclusively for the XBOX.
premise: + Until Dawn + Until Dawn is an interactive drama survival horror adventure video game developed by Supermassive Games and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation 4 . + PlayStation 3 + The PlayStation 3 ( PS3 ) is a home video game console developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment . + PlayStation 4 + PlayStation 4 ( PS4 ) is a line of home video game consoles developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment . + Until Dawn + It was originally scheduled to be released on the PlayStation 3 and feature PlayStation Move support , but in August 2014 the game was reintroduced as a PlayStation 4 exclusive , and was released worldwide in August 2015 . + Adventure game + An adventure game is a video game in which the player assumes the role of protagonist in an interactive story driven by exploration and puzzle-solving .
explanation_1: Until Dawn was released exclusively for the PlayStation 4.

hypothesis: RB Leipzig is based in Europe.
premise: + RB Leipzig + RasenBallsport Leipzig e.V. , commonly known as RB Leipzig , is a German association football club based in Leipzig , Saxony . + Leipzig + Leipzig  is the largest city in the federal state of Saxony , Germany . + Saxony + The Free State of Saxony ( der Freistaat Sachsen  Swobodny stat Sakska ) is a landlocked federal state of Germany , bordering the federal states of Brandenburg , Saxony Anhalt , Thuringia , and Bavaria , as well as the countries of Poland ( Lower Silesian and Lubusz Voivodeships ) and the Czech Republic ( Karlovy Vary , Liberec and Ústí nad Labem Regions ) .
explanation_1: RB Leipzig is based in Leipzig, Saxony, Germany.

hypothesis: Daniel Day-Lewis is a self-taught actor.
premise: + Daniel Day-Lewis + Despite his traditional actor training at the Bristol Old Vic , he is considered to be a method actor , known for his constant devotion to and research of his roles . + Daniel Day-Lewis + Sir Daniel Michael Blake Day-Lewis ( born 29 April 1957 ) is an English actor who holds both British and Irish citizenship . + Bristol Old Vic + Bristol Old Vic is a British theatre company based at the Theatre Royal , Bristol .
explanation_1: Daniel Day-Lewis is a method actor, however he is not self-taught.

hypothesis: Gorillaz is not a band.
premise: + Plastic Beach + Plastic Beach is the third studio album by the British virtual band Gorillaz , released on 3 March 2010 by Parlophone Records internationally and by Virgin Records in the United States . + Gorillaz + Gorillaz are an English virtual band created in 1998 by musician Damon Albarn and artist Jamie Hewlett . + The Fall (Gorillaz album) + The Fall is the fourth studio album from British virtual band Gorillaz . + Demon Days + Demon Days is the second studio album by British virtual band Gorillaz , released on 11 May 2005 in Japan and on 23 May internationally by Parlophone Records and in the United States by Virgin Records . + Humanz + Humanz is the fifth studio album by British virtual band Gorillaz .
explanation_1: Gorillaz is a band.

hypothesis: Citadelle Laferrière is in the Dominican Republic.
premise: + Citadelle Laferrière + The Citadelle Laferrière or , Citadelle Henry Christophe , or simply the Citadelle ( Citadel ) , is a large mountaintop fortress in Nord , Haiti , located on top of the mountain Bonnet a L'Eveque , approximately 17 mi south of the city of Cap-Haïtien , 10 mi southwest of the Three Bays Protected Area , and 5 mi uphill from the town of Milot . + Haiti + Haiti (  Haïti  Ayiti  ) , officially the Republic of Haiti and formerly called Hayti , is a country located on the island of Hispaniola in the Greater Antilles archipelago of the Caribbean Sea . + Haiti + It occupies the western three-eighths of the island , which it shares with the Dominican Republic . + Citadelle Laferrière + The mountaintop fortress has itself become an icon of Haiti .
explanation_1: Citadelle Laferrière is in Haiti.

hypothesis: The Golden Girls passed over Betty White for a role in the show.
premise: + The Golden Girls + The show stars Beatrice Arthur , Betty White , Rue McClanahan , and Estelle Getty , as four older women who share a home in Miami , Florida . + Betty White + Betty Marion White Ludden ( known professionally as Betty White ; born January 17 , 1922 ) is an American actress , with the longest television career of a female entertainer .

hypothesis: The stratosphere is above the mesosphere.
premise: + Stratosphere + The stratosphere  is the second major layer of Earth 's atmosphere , just above the troposphere , and below the mesosphere .

hypothesis: Matt Smith's first major role in television was in Peru.
premise: + Matt Smith (actor) + Smith 's first television role came in 2006 as Jim Taylor in the BBC adaptations of Philip Pullman 's The Ruby in the Smoke and The Shadow in the North , while his first major role in television came as Danny in the 2007 BBC series Party Animals . + Party Animals (TV series) + Party Animals is a British television drama series screened on BBC Two in 2007 .
explanation_1: Matt Smith's first major role in television was in Party Animals, not in Peru.

hypothesis: The theory that the cell is the basic functional unit of all living organisms has been thoroughly disproven.
premise: + Cell (biology) + Cell theory , first developed in 1839 by Matthias Jakob Schleiden and Theodor Schwann , states that all organisms are composed of one or more cells , that cells are the fundamental unit of structure and function in all living organisms , that all cells come from preexisting cells , and that all cells contain the hereditary information necessary for regulating cell functions and for transmitting information to the next generation of cells . + Cell theory + These cells are the basic unit of structure in all organisms and also the basic unit of reproduction . + Cell (biology) + The cell ( from Latin cella , meaning `` small room '' ) is the basic structural , functional , and biological unit of all known living organisms . + Cell theory + In biology , cell theory is a scientific theory which describes the properties of cells .
explanation_1: The theory that the cell is the basic functional unit of all living organisms has not been disproven.

hypothesis: Lymelife is a comedy-drama podcast.
premise: + Lymelife + Lymelife is a 2008 independent comedy-drama film written by brothers Derick Martini and Steven Martini , and directed by Derick Martini , depicting aspects of their life in 1970s Long Island from the perspective of a teenager . + Independent film + An independent film or indie film is a feature film that is produced outside of the major film studio system , in addition to being produced and distributed by independent entertainment agencies .
explanation_1: Lymelife is a 2008 independent film depicting aspects of the life in 1970s Long Island from the perspective of a teenager.
